alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Prince George and northeastern Dinwiddie Counties and the City of Petersburg through 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Matoaca, or near Petersburg, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Carson, New Bohemia, Petersburg Airport, Richard Bland College, Burgess, Templeton, Addison, Reams and Prince George Golf. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
